Name: Sourav
Heading: GEHU- Review
Review:
1:- having an interest in computers led me to choose this course.
2:-there are not enough faculty (one faculty) who have to complete the syllabus in roughly 4-5 sections of the student.

But a major problem is that in the CSE branch most of the time faculties are interchanged.
Faculties are not placed as per their quality.
 they have just filled the vacated positions.

syllabus was not completed.

Name: Sourav
Heading: GEHU- Review
Review:
1:- having an interest in computers led me to choose this course.
2:-there are not enough faculty (one faculty) who have to complete the syllabus in roughly 4-5 sections of the student.
3:-faculties are well qualified. Most of them have a good experience of teaching.
But a major problem is that in the CSE branch most of the time faculties are interchanged.
Faculties are not placed as per their quality.
 they have just filled the vacated positions.
Honestly, it feels that 6 months are not enough to complete the syllabus of one semester.
Roughly Mid sem are conducted after 1.5 months into the semester and end-term are conducted after 5 months. University provides semester timetable. During the corona period, online exams were timely completed. 
But as the offline year started there was a major gap in syllabus completion and exams.
syllabus was not completed.
Exams are not that tough to face, apart from a few subjects most of them ask basic to high-level questions depending on a particular subject.

Name: Vishal
Heading: HONEST REVIEW OF JSS NOIDA
Review: ALL COURSE BOOKS YOU WILL GET THROUGH LIBRARY.LIBRARY IS QUITE GOOD AND BIG ENOUGH. BUT NOBODY READS BOOKS IN ENGINEERING AND ONE BOOK IS MOST FAMOUS 'QUANTUM' . THIS SMALL BOOK IS ENOUGH TO GET GOOD MARKS . BUT DO NOT BUY IT YOU WANT TO DO ENGINEERING SERIOUSLY IT IS FOR THE END MOMENTS. MOST CHILLED BRANCH IN OUR COLLEGE IS IT AND MOST HACTIC ONE IS ECE. SO BE CAREFUL IF YOU ARE GOING TO TAKE ECE IN THIS COLLEGE . I DO NOT PREFER STUDENTS TO TAKE CORE BRANCHES IN THIS COLLEGE BECAUSE THERE IS NO PLACEMENT FOR CORE BRANCHES ...ONE SOCIETY IS VERY FAMOUS IN OUR COLLEGE NAMED NIBBLE WHICH IS A COMPUTER SCIENCE SOCIETY. IF YOU GET RECRUITED IN THIS SOCIETY THEN YOUR PLACEMENT IS FOR SURE..

For term exams, since I am still in 1st semester, so, there have not been term tests till now. But as my seniors have told me about exams, they are not considered, that much hard to pass.

College: Shri Ramswaroop Memorial College of Engineering and Management -  [SRMCM]

Name: Sivalakshimi
Heading: MY SRC MY PRIDE
Review: The entire campus is filled with trees which provides fresh air and a green environment. It's clean and neat. My college has a massive open air theatre and closed auditorium too. Big playground, water and sanitation facilities, solar panels are there. There is a big library in which thousands of books are there to enrich our student's knowledge. Our classroom is big and spacious and it's attached to a smartboard. The students are involved in many extracurricular activities like NSS, NCC, YRC and sports. Every year college union inauguration and cultures will be conducted. We used to participate in that with happiness. Clubs include save the green club, student union, student discipline committee etc are the best platform for the students to exhibit their talents.

Name: SAITY BANERJEE
College: Symbiosis Centre for Management and Human Resource Development - [SCMHRD]
Heading: SCHMRD, Pune will make sure that you get opportunities to grow both personally and professionally
Review: I am currently pursuing MBA in operations from SCHMRD, Pune as it is one of the most amazing colleges for the same. The college offers decent placement packages and also ample opportunities to grow and learn. The faculties I feel are highly educated and also try to engage and motivate students by introducing new ways of learning. Exams are conducted after every trimester.

Name: Monica Parmar
Heading: Things to know  before Addmission in SDCET, Ghaziabad.
Review:
Mr and Miss Fresher, Annual Deep Mahotsav, farewell and multidimensional events are conducted every year. once in 2 or 3 years sports activities at the regional level are conducted. Quiz competitions are organised annually. Programs are conducted by collaborating with other colleges of Sunderdeep college. All colleges are placed on the same campus only, only buildings and workshops are different. 
A good campus area promotes well growth opportunities. There are 2 canteens on the campus with all required facilities, but they are a little crowded. College is very well connected to the highway so no difficulty in commutation. College buses are also provided in case you want to consider them but are expensive plus the timings are rigid.
Books are available,  sometimes you have to wait for a specific book but that's normal. At a time 4books can be available. NO BOOK bank available. If demand for a book is there, they will buy the book also.

Name: Shashank Sharma
Heading: Umesh Chandra College of Commerce
Review: All the faculty members are just top notch. Many doctorates also take classes in undergraduate courses. Each class has a mentor/counsellor for the students to guide them academically and support them emotionally. There is no scope for rot learning, every concept is explained through its practical application via the use of technology like excel sheets, presentations, etc. In the first year, a subject for holistic development is also taught for students all round development. Term exams are conducted right on time. There are no delays in the commencement of the examination. Semester wise calendars are issued to keep the track of the courses right on time. Exams are not difficult to pass at all if have paid attention in the regular classes and have done the self study in due time. 40% is the passing criteria in all the subjects. Further separate marks are given for assignments, attendance and mid-terms which are eventually aggregated in the final semester examination.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: Shri Govindram Seksaria Institute of Technology and Science- [SGSITS]
Heading: A complete Guide
Review: Fees for the Electrical engineering depatment in our college is 91500 for a year. The scholarship we get is Mukhya Mantri Medhavi Vidhyarthi Yojna (MMVY)  by the government of Madhya Pradesh in which we get our fees beck paid to the college.

Name: Meenu Nair
Heading: NIT Tadepalligudem Review
Review: The curriculum of NIT is quite popular for technology students but trust me management curriculum is also not behind and it is far better than many so claim B-school of India. The curriculum is divided into 4 semesters and the first two semesters are based on providing knowledge about the basic concepts of management and helping students to understand the importance of management skills in the corporate world. The last two semesters are based on industrial visits and how to apply theoretical knowledge in real-world scenarios. The last 2 semesters are based on case studies that are properly in sync with real-world scenarios, The main objective of the curriculum does develop students as future managers and leaders that can lead corporate houses from the front.

Name: Jay Shankar Prasad
Heading: III UNA Review
Review: Why I decided to be part of the Indian Institute of Information Technology Una because IIITs are very popular for their placement. Indian Institute of Information Technology Una is not behind the average package of the college goes up to 8.60 LPA and the highest package for our batch was 14.50 LPA. Companies like L&T, InfoTech, Ittiam, Greyb, Analytics Quotient, Ebiz On, First American, Grey B, Analytics, eBiz 4.0, Envestnet, Wipro, TCS, Cognizant, and Infosys are few companies that visited our campus during the placement drive. The college placement committee is also quite supportive and helpful.

Name: Sandeep Ahuja
College: Fairfield Institute of Management and Technology - [FIMT]
Heading: College has many social group and everyone is supportive
Review: The campus life of the college is very good. The college has a very good canteen where we hang out with friends. The canteen is fully air conditioned and there is a good seating arrangement. The college has many social groups and clubs which participate in any event at the college level and university level. I was part of the dance club and let to learn lots of things. For extracurricular activities, the college has a gym facility and indoor sports. The infrastructure of the college is good. Labs and library of the college have very well setup.

Name: Dip Pramanik
Heading: Honest experience in WBSU
Review:
Our university does not organize many cultural programs. They do not encourage extra circular activities. we did not have any kind of annual fest & fresher's welcome. 
We have a huge library with all kinds of books available. But many more books to come because I have seen many department's books are missing. However, it's a great place & very well decorated with colorful racks.
Our university campus is very good but people who are sitting in the official work department are the worst. Their behavior is very bad. They will harass you for small problems. You can't solve your problem in one day. They just keep giving another date. It is very much awful.
We did not have any kind of sports activity. At least I have not seen anything. Lastly I want to say if you came here with lot of dreams and expectation you will be very much disappointed.

Name: Sushruth
College: IIM Ranchi Indian Institute of Management
Heading: Multiple opportunities are provided
Review:
The course curriculum is nicely structured as per the industry requirements. It includes a complete analytics curriculum starting from the very basics which makes it easy for any non enthusiastic person to turn around. My previous experience as Python Developer made me attracted to analytics and so I chose this course. Faculty to student ratio is nearly 1:~4-5 for this batch (considering only IS faculty and BA students)
All the faculty are highly qualified in the domain and they carry rich teaching experience. They follow very practical approaches in teaching. 
The course is spread across 2 years with 6 terms in complete. Each term is for nearly 12-14 weeks.
Proper listening to class regularly and practising the classwork would be sufficient for easy passing in exams. I don't think passing is a difficult task for once who got admission into the college.

Name: Aravinda Halvi
Heading: A gIIFTed college
Review:
MBA in International Business - the only college in India to provide this degree. The USP of the institute is its trade subjects.
The average class size is 50 students. 
The faculties are really great and have Ph. D degrees from various prestigious universities which them the best people to be taught from.
6 trimesters - 6 end term exams and midterms depend on respective faculty
Difficulty level of exams - moderate

Name: Bhargavi Dhoble
College: Dr. YSR National Institute of Tourism and Hospitality Management - [NITHM]
Heading: Progressive- NITHM
Review: Our college provides an internship of all the relevant types to the students. They provide hotel internships in 5-star hotels such as Taj Falaknuma, Taj Deccan, Oberoi hotels, Radisson Blu, Heritage Hotels, etc. There they teach and train students about all the work at all the departments of the hotel including the etiquette and the golden rules to be followed in a hotel, make them learn and perform some tasks and students make notes every day as a journal. Our college provides internships for event management. There, students are being trained for food and beverage mostly and to work with the event manager and learn the strategy to plan, execute and train the employees. Then, there is an opportunity for tourism internships such as tour walks, tour guides, recruiting, etc. Here, students are trained to gather information about all the famous places in that area and talk professionally with tourists. The last one is for sales and marketing internship where students are connected with marketing strategies.

Name: Karan Suvarna
College: Thakur Institute of Management Studies and Research - [TIMSR]
Heading: PGDM Finance - TIMSR
Review: TIMSR has many national and international conferences conducted for the benefit of the business students all year round. Other fests are Evoke, Ekvatam, and Pulse where Evoke is the annual intercollege fest for management, ekvatam is the cultural fest and pulse is a sports event. All are conducted on a grand scale and are very exciting to participate in and also watch. There are student bodies such as Student Council and clubs related to various filed such a marketing, finance, HR, etc.

Name: RIYA GUPTA
Heading: Decent B-School

The classrooms are well furnished and air-conditioned They have smart boards and blackboards Library is there with books related to your course and you can issue them anytime there is no sports room playground in the campus Several clubs run by the students and headed by a faculty Marketing club, finance club, Hr club many more.

LNCT N ALL

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Chandigarh University - A Rising Star
Review:
Since Starting I was Interested in App Development and Programming so it was clear to me that I'm Gonna to Choose CSE Coz It has Great Opportunities in the Future. And Chandigarh University was Doing well in this Field with Amazing Placement Records and Their Infrastructure. 
And When We Talk About Faculty: Students at CU it's Like 20:1 Including Non-Teaching Staff. They are always available for our help and Queries. 
Teachers are Well Qualified and Trained for thier Individual Subjects, Mostly Teachers are with Ph.D. From Well Known Institutions like IIT and BITS. They Always Guide us About Extra Things Also Like Future in Research, Future in Mathematics And All. They are so Helping and Thier Teaching way is Just Amazing. 
Now Talk about Exams, The Point where it's time to show our strength, Our Hardwork, Our Studies. Exams at CU are Really of Good Level. Sometimes They Put Questions Like GATE Exam Level and It's Not Easy to Crack them if you have not done your work on time.

Name: ABHISHEK
Heading: 1st batch of bcom
Review:
No interneships were offered during our time even no assistance was given as we were the very first batch there. 

No projects were there at the time, and it was not so smooth at that time. What cu is today I am quite sure it was not it back then.

Name: Devansh
Heading: Faculty and placements
Review: I choose this course because the main reason is that there is lot of demand of employees in IT sector, There are lot of well-educated faculty here which is very talented and helpful here. There is one teacher on 35 students for 1st year and for 2nd, 3rd, 4th year there is one teacher for 45 students. The teachers here is very supportive and brilliant here, they have minimum 15 years of experience, the level of exams is moderate, if you do study daily on small amount.

Name: P Pavithra
Heading: Review on paradise
Review: I am enjoying my college life, it is one of the precious things in my life. I will say simply, it is a paradise of angels. In order to welcome our freshers, a cultural fest will be conducted in the month of July and many events will be conducted continuously. In our library a lot of were available, for each department, a separate session is present, e searching facilities are also there for students. There is an individual department for sports. Our college students participated in many events and won prizes a lot. NSS, NCC, YRC, green clubs like these social groups are run by our students.

Name: murari gaurav
College: Academy of Maritime Education and Training University - [AMET]
Heading: Intership opportunities at AMET
Review:
I choose this course because I love learning more things about machines/engines.
After admission, you will get a mentor 1:20 ratio. 1 mentor for 20 students which is great. If you are having any problem, just share it with your mentor, and he will guide you.
Faculty are both mixed, good and bad. Actually, no faculty is bad, it's just that their teaching methodology is different and you didn't cope up with that.
Some teachers are like you will love them, and some you will start hating. Anyway, it's the matter of every college, you have to learn by yourself and stop depending upon professor's to teach. Use the library inside the campus to learn.
Here due to lockdown, everything is delayed. I can't say it with a guarantee but for me, my session started in November 2021, and from 24th January, I am having my CAT-1 Exam.

Name: Shraddha satnami
Heading: Review of my life plan
Review: The seniors of our college give us the freshers party and on the 1st day of college, there was an orientation day. Our library provides us with the book for 6 months give us 4 books at one time whatever the boom we want there are  basketball court and a big group badminton court too but we have to bring the playing equipment from our own which I don't like I don't get time to play there is 3 Whatsapp group which are run by teachers and one by seniors too.

Name: DIVYANSHU VARSHNEY
College: MNNIT Allahabad - Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology - [MNNIT]
Heading: MNNIT ALLAHABD'S REVIEW FROM AN MNNITian
Review:
Campus life is Campus life, there are no words for it. We only go for 2 months in college and the rest is online, and those 2 months are speechless.
There are fests, annual fests are CULRAV and SWAGAT for freshers (which we attend in online mode ;_; ), a tech event AVISHKAR, which is the most imp. event from an academics point of view. And as it's an NIT, so timely many personalities, alumni come in college. So it's not stress taking topic.
There are Library and it's a big & good library, there's a multipurpose hall, playgrounds, tennis court, basketball court, volleyball, kabaddi court, and many things regarding sports or refreshment purpose.
There's are many clubs from tech to academics, from dramatic to sports. 
so no worry about college life, just you to learn time management.

Name: belal hbib
Heading: Jamia Millia Islamia New Delhi review.
Review:
Jamia Millia Islamia Conduct Miraas as its annual fest and may technical fest which is organized by the engineering department.
The central Library dr Zakir Hussain Library provides you with every book easily.
The classrooms are very beautiful and air conditioned. In every classroom, there is a projector.
Jamia has a big sports complex beside the campus. Many games are played here.
Jamia Millia Islamia has many Cultural students. so you find groups of every ideology.
I know some of them which I connected, geeksofjamia and Bhartiya Jamia meme party.
They are available on insta.

Name: Anant jain
Heading: SIBM Pune will give you ample opportunities to learn and grow
Review: I chose the MBA program of SIBM, Pune because Symbiosis is one of the best colleges for MBA, it offers extensive learning opportunities and also opportunities to grow. It has an amazing brand value. Faculties are highly educated and the teaching method is collaborative and fun. Exams are conducted after almost every 3 months with quizzes and assignment submissions on a day-to-day basis. The faculty to student ratio is 1:30.

Name: Mahender Singh
Heading: VIT Pune Review
Review: The placement record of the college is 100%. The placement committee is very helpful and supportive. Each and every member of the placement committee is very experienced and have industrial exposure and they work as a guiding force for students during the placement drive. During our time almost 175+ companies visited the campus. Companies like Mercedes Benz, Accenture, TATA Technologies, TATA Motors, Thermax, Deloitte, Cognizant, Infosys, ITC, Maruti visited our campus during the placement drive. The highest package went up to 28 LPA and the average package during the placement was 9 LPA.

Name: Daljit Singh
Heading: Umesh Chandra College of Commerce
Review: I want to be a commerce graduate so I took up Bcom Hons as it is more renowned than the general one for good jobs. The faculty of the college is top notch who make us understand the topic through practical examples. The teaching staff is highly qualified. Term exams are held every 6 months. Firstly an internal exam of 20 marks is held in the college and then an external exam of 80 marks take place where seats fall in different colleges as per Cu guidelines.

Name: Anuj Dhar
College: Indian Institute of Engineering Science and Technology - [IIEST] Shibpur
Heading: IIEST Shibpur Review
Review: The placement record of the college is 100%. the college placement committee is expert and well experienced and knows how to attract MNC. The placement committee will guide you and help you out during the placement. My only reason to join IIEST Shibpur was its placement record. The highest package for our batch went up to 26 LPA and the average package was 17 LPA only a few colleges in India provide such a great package. Companies like Microsoft, HSBC Technologies, Maruti, Infosys, Oracle are the companies that visit the campus during the placement drive.

Name: Atul Vaishya
College: Institute of Engineering and Rural Technology - [IERT]
Heading: Easily Prepare for Govt. jobs
Review: There are many kinds of the fest that are organized by the seniors. Technovation, Udbhav, Freshers, and many other fests are organized in the college. Most of the events are organized in a period of time when there is not the pressure of exams and unit tests. Life at the campus is not full of enjoyment as the main focus of the college on the students is to focus on his study rather than any other thing. There is a big library in which students can issue their books for 6 months. Classes are conducted through green boards with old infrastructure and no renovation. Sports events such as Zonal levels, kreeda kumbh, hostel premier league are organized with all kinds of sports played from all years students branch wise and year wise. Position of responsibility is also provided to students who are very good at academics and other activities. Till now there are no social groups created by the students.

Name: Hruti sharma
College: Teerthanker Mahaveer University, College of Engineering - [TMU COE]
Heading: Teerthankar Mahaveer university is best
Review: In teerthankar Mahaveer University, placements are a big dream for students. In tmu, here is a special drive called placement drive takes place. It is for placement purposes. The students who are in their final year can join this drive. During this drive, the faculty members teach students about important things and technology which are going to be useful in the interview round. In TMU, mostly TCS Virgeo, Flipkart,  Jaro education, etc companies visit. The average package provided to students is 3 lakhs per annum and the highest package given in tmu for technical students is 9 lakhs per annum. 70 percent of students get placed in Teerthankar Mahaveer university. My plan after getting the degree is to get placed in a well-reputed multinational company with a package of 8 to 9 lakhs per annum.

College: Guru Jambheshwar University of Science and Technology - [GJUS&T]
Heading: GJUS&T small review
Review: The courses are good. There is a vast number of courses available and like all other colleges, you mostly have to do things on your own. I chose this course cause I like computer science. The student ratio is 70% boys and 30% girls. The faculty is not that good, they need to co-operate more. Exams are taken time but it is difficult to pass without studying.

Name: Shilwanti Gangadhar
Heading: Government Polytechnic College Solapur Review
Review: Speaking about placements college or university takes a total of 6 semesters college makes students available in the 5th semester for taking placements offered by the college. It provides the placement with about 6 lakhs per year minimum which makes students take admission here.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: Jyothishmathi Institute of Technology and Science - [JITS]
Heading: Simple college review
Review:
Swecha, Infosys, IBM, and some companies provide internships. Many major and mini-projects are done by students and got gold medals from jntuh university.
Projects based on VLSI embedded systems and college got a research and development block which contain loads of upgraded equipment.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Review by stoner
Review:
I chose this course just because my father wanted me to choose this otherwise I'd have chosen CSE. Although the time we got admission in the college there was this wide program going on called "TEQUIP-III", due to this our branch had almost 10-12 faculty members but now last I heard that changed last year and only 3 permanent faculty left and a couple of lab assistants maybe and in first-year students strength in our branch was 60 and later in the second year it increased to 80 (due to diploma students admissions). 
Faculty during the TEQIP program were highly qualified from different IITs and NITs, although there were a couple of bad teachers there were also some good teachers as you'd find in every college. The permanent faculty was quite good and helpful, especially Dr. Ganpat Sir (HOD of Civil Eng.).
Term exams were conducted in a timely manner until corona happened. Although the university's (RTU which applied on us and in the next year it changed to BTU).

Name: Kavibarathi S M
Heading: An institution which embrace culture and education.
Review: I chose B.Com as I wanted to be a student who could gain more knowledge in the subject in order to achieve my ambition to become a Chartered Accountant. My faculty helps every student to practice and expose. I feel better with the teaching of the faculty. They teach us in a way that we can practically analyze things. They make students feel confident in attending exams. In a semester, we usually attend two portioned exams and a model exam before the semester examination. It wouldn't be that difficult to pass an examination as we are well-practiced frequently with simple tests in a week and so.

Name: Pratik Sutradhar
Heading: Good college for Technical Knowledge
Review: College overall education process is good. Good teachers teach students. Faculty members minimum qualification is m-tech. Some PhD holders are present in every department. The environment is student-friendly. They always provide special classes for weak students. Every time they are ready to help students. They give special classes before exams. Teacher-student ratio is 6:1 . I have interest in machines, motors from my childhood that's why I have chosen the mechanical department. There are 4 internal exams during one semester. If students follow teachers' guides carefully they can easily pass even they can score well. During semester exam there is an external invigilator and CCTV is installed in every exam hall.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: A good college in DU with decent crowd but great faculties.
Review: Delhi University is famous for its cultural fests Every year MLNC organizes cultural festivals for 2 days Celebrities Bollywood singers, famous bands performing It was a great and fun experience. There are many clubs in MLNC they are very good especially the dramatics and Dance club which is Electraectra They have won many competitions  Seminars and Workshops used to be held very frequently infrastructure of MLNC is also good They have basic amenities facilities like drinking water hygiene washroom stationery shop, photocopy there is an also a separate room for girls which is known as the girl's common room The library is huge which is filled with thousands of books We could issue any book as per our requirement anytime Classes are huge with wooden benches There is a block known as the j block where air-conditioned are installed in the classes. MLNC has a huge campus with lots of greenery

Name: Vansh Chauhan
Heading: Hey!! Welcome to Nit kurukshetra
Review: The campus of nit Kurukshetra is around the Fest culture of NIT Kurukshetra is superb but only when you are willing to involve. There are 2 major fests, one is Confluence (Annual Cultural fest) and another is Techspardha (Annual Techno-Managerial Fest). Since I am a member of the Photography Club for 3 years, I can assure you that if you are part of a club or society you will learn a lot during the preparation and management of these fests. The 95% work of the fests is done by students only, teachers are not much support so all the ground control is also in the hands of students. And the best part about fests is post-fest parties and trips.

Name: preeti
Heading: NIRF Ranking #1 since four consecutive years. This is huge.
Review:
Approximately 15k-20k is the fee that you've to submit per year for Chemistry. College offers scholarships both on basis of academic merit and for economically weaker backgrounds. So anyone can avail themselves by meeting the eligibility criteria. All the info is available on the college website or Delhi university website also one can ask in the college admin office.
I don't have much idea about the placements provided for my course since most of the students from my batch opted for higher studies or competitive exam preparation. But there's a placement cell in our college that provides various internships and job opportunities.
